name: places/ChIJqyWAwupZwokRbgy2u3LKsrM
formattedAddress: 755 Washington St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 755 Washington St, New York, NY 10014-1746, USA

originalText.text:
I was treated so poorly and arrogantly by the assigned sales consultant that I felt like a subhuman. This individual made me feel completely out of place. I was searching for a top for my boyfriend. The sales consultant briefly guided me to the location and explained where to find items, which went smoothly. However, when I found something suitable but was uncertain about the size, I wanted to show the salesperson a picture and explain my boyfriend's body type. They neither listened properly nor bothered to look at the pictures, let alone provide any meaningful advice. I kept receiving dismissive responses and a look that didn't help me at all.

When I enter a boutique, I expect to be treated with respect. I didn't make an appointment and wait just to experience this kind of service. Secondly, who on earth thinks they are better than another person? After all, I am the one coming here to shop, not to work. When I was ready to pay and the salesperson saw my gold credit card, suddenly I was treated better. What's going on? Someone with such an attitude should not be working in sales if they want to maintain a positive reputation. This was my first and last time shopping at this store. I won't let myself be treated like that by someone who is no better than anyone else.
All the other employees were very friendly and helpful!

originalText.text:
Had an amazing experience with Kirk—super informative and a great character. Really appreciate the time and effort he puts in to make shopping enjoyable.

The store is spacious, adorned with quality woodwork and cool Chrome Heart Art installations. The second floor features a fantastic furniture/living room/kitchen section.

A must-visit if you're into Leather, Patchwork, Silver Jewellery, Rock 'n' Roll, Gothic, and craftsmanship.

Quick heads up for new visitors: you need to make an appointment to visit. Just head to the Chrome Heart website, click on store location, and find the "schedule an appointment" link.

It can get super annoying because you can't try on some clothing pieces. So, it's best to know your size, ask the staff for size guidance, and let them know the fit you're aiming for.

originalText.text: Service was amazing, provide you with your own personal shopping assistant, best location by far.

text.text: Service was amazing, provide you with your own personal shopping assistant, best location by far.

originalText.text: I just recently purchased a piece that I need help repairing , I was told by the manager " Jason" that it was a definite yes to walk in earlier in the day, and that they do except walk-ins and that I don't need to schedule an appointment once I got to the chrome heart which took me 30 minutes, the security guard told me that there will be a 15 minute wait and that once I go and come back that everything will be OK for my walk in to be accepted once I came back he told me that I couldn't enter, which to me made no sense because he just told me The opposite he then rudely  told me to leave so I do not recommend this store location at all for jewelry purchases or any purchases I give it a zero if I could give it zero stars I would and it was completely a waste of my time and a waste of my energy to even entertain this type of company with this type of people and staff. Either the people should be replaced immediately or this location should be shut down and turn into a different store this type of behavior is unacceptable and dishonest and it makes the chrome heart brand look poor this is very poor service.

originalText.text: I wish I could give a zero-star rating. I don't know when this store started requiring appointments. I arrived here 43 minutes before closing time. A couple in front of me was asked if they had an appointment and was allowed inside. However, the receptionist and security personnel seemed displeased when they saw that we had two children with us. They said they were no longer accepting visitors without appointments today. We explained that we had walked 40 minutes from SOHO with our children. The staff seemed indifferent and only emphasized their rules. I don't think anyone did anything wrong, but I just didn't feel any sense of care or humanity in the brand's culture. I definitely won't come back here, and I won't be following this brand anymore.
